meanings.definition: (verb) To flow or leak slowly in a steady stream.
meanings.sent1: The syrup oozed out of the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The honey oozed from the comb.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate oozed so slowly that it seemed to be playing a game.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness oozed out of every gesture she made.
meanings.sent5: The lava oozed down the volcano, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Exuding or emitting slowly and steadily.
meanings.sent1: The oozed slime was sticky to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The oozed sap smelled sweet in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The oozed paint made the wall look like a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The oozed scent of flowers filled the room with a pleasant aroma.
meanings.sent5: The oozed cheese on the pizza was gooey and delicious.
